    Returns the event handler for clicking the home button When activated, this method takes the user from the load menu to the home screen if they click the back button.

    Returns the event handler that handles the report generation when the generate report button is clicked in ReportView.

    Returns the event handler for clicking the show / hide gridlines button When activated, this method toggles the gridlines being shown

    Returns the event handler for initiating drawing a plot This method is activated when the user starts to drag their mouse on the canvas.

    Returns the event handler for while the plot is being drawn This method is activated while the user is dragging their mouse.
    javafx.event.EventHandler getDrawPlotHandler()
    Returns the event handler for draw plot button in plotdesignview When activated, this method creates a new plot in the garden with the user specified soil, sunlight and moisture.

    Returns the event Handler for clicking the learn more button When activated, this method opens the learn more page

    Returns the event handler for clicking the load garden button in the main screen.

    Returns the event handler for when the image is dropped This method is activated when the user releases their mouse and the drag and drop is completed.

    Returns the event handler for while the plant/image is being dragged This method is activated while the user is dragging a plant in the garden editor

    javafx.event.EventHandler getOnImageDraggedHandler()
    Returns the event handler for initiating drag and drop of a plant This method is activated when the user begins dragging a plant within the garden editor When activated, a plant is selected either from the recommended bar or within a plot and the drag and drop action is started

    Returns the event handler for selecting a plant in the garden editor This method is activated when a user clicks on or hovers over a plant image When activated, this method selects a plant to show information about in the view

    Returns the change listener for plot design height change When activated, this method sets a new scale based on the resulting height and redraws the grid to fit in the new canvas
    javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener<java.lang.Object> getPDWidthChangeListener()
    Returns the change listener for plot design width change When activated, this method sets a new scale based on the resulting width and redraws the grid to fit in the new canvas
    javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener getPlotSelectHandler()
    Returns the change listener that activates when a plot is selected in the plots dropdown This method changes the recommended plant list to be based on the selected plot
    javafx.event.EventHandler getRedrawPlotHandler()
    Returns the event handler for clicking the redraw button When activated, this method erases the current plot and lets the user redraw the plot.

    • setUpGardenEditor

      public void setUpGardenEditor()
      Sets up the model and the view for the garden editor page. Resizes plots to fill the garden editor canvas, smoothes the scaled plots, sets a value for pixels per foot (scale), draws the plots, updates the in-garden counts, and sets the recommended plant list

    • getSetDimensionsClickedHandler

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getSetDimensionsClickedHandler()
      Returns the event handler for set dimensions button clicked When activated, this method sets the scale of the garden based on the dimension inputs. A grid is drawn with the user's specifications
      Returns:
      event handler

    • getPDHeightChangeListener

      public javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener<java.lang.Object> getPDHeightChangeListener()
      Returns the change listener for plot design height change When activated, this method sets a new scale based on the resulting height and redraws the grid to fit in the new canvas
      Returns:
      change listener

    • getPDWidthChangeListener

      public javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener<java.lang.Object> getPDWidthChangeListener()
      Returns the change listener for plot design width change When activated, this method sets a new scale based on the resulting width and redraws the grid to fit in the new canvas
      Returns:
      change listener

    • getDrawPlotHandler

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getDrawPlotHandler()
      Returns the event handler for draw plot button in plotdesignview When activated, this method creates a new plot in the garden with the user specified soil, sunlight and moisture. The canvas in the plotdesignview is "unlocked" so the user can draw
      Returns:
      event handler

    • getRedrawPlotHandler

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getRedrawPlotHandler()
      Returns the event handler for clicking the redraw button When activated, this method erases the current plot and lets the user redraw the plot.
      Returns:
      event handler

    • getDrawPlotDragDetected

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getDrawPlotDragDetected()
      Returns the event handler for initiating drawing a plot This method is activated when the user starts to drag their mouse on the canvas. Begins a path and starts recording coordinates for the plot boundaries
      Returns:
      event handler

    • getDrawPlotDragged

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getDrawPlotDragged()
      Returns the event handler for while the plot is being drawn This method is activated while the user is dragging their mouse. When activated, coordinates for the plot are recorded
      Returns:
      event handler

    • getOnDrawPlotDone

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getOnDrawPlotDone()
      Returns the event handler for when the plot is done drawing. This method is activated after the user finishes drawing a plot, when the mouse/drag is released. The plot coordinates get added to the garden and the final plot shape is filled in
      Returns:
      event handler

    • getOnImageEnteredInfo

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getOnImageEnteredInfo()
      Returns the event handler for selecting a plant in the garden editor This method is activated when a user clicks on or hovers over a plant image When activated, this method selects a plant to show information about in the view
      Returns:
      event handler

    • getOnImageDraggedHandler

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getOnImageDraggedHandler()
      Returns the event handler for initiating drag and drop of a plant This method is activated when the user begins dragging a plant within the garden editor When activated, a plant is selected either from the recommended bar or within a plot and the drag and drop action is started
      Returns:
      event handler

    • getOnDragOverHandler

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getOnDragOverHandler()
      Returns the event handler for while the plant/image is being dragged This method is activated while the user is dragging a plant in the garden editor
      Returns:
      event handler

    • getOnDragDroppedHandler

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getOnDragDroppedHandler()
      Returns the event handler for when the image is dropped This method is activated when the user releases their mouse and the drag and drop is completed. When activated, this method adds the plant to the plot it belongs to (or removes the plant from the garden)
      Returns:
      event handler

    • getSortByHandler

      public javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener getSortByHandler()

      Returns:
      ChangeListener

    • listClickedHandler

      public javafx.event.EventHandler listClickedHandler()
      Returns the Event handler for comparison dropdown in compPlantView. On list click, this handler finds the element clicked on, gets the corresponding information from CompPlants, and sends the gotten info to compPlantsView.
      Returns:
      event handler

    • getDisplayGridlinesHandler

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getDisplayGridlinesHandler()
      Returns the event handler for clicking the show / hide gridlines button When activated, this method toggles the gridlines being shown
      Returns:
      ChangeListener

    • SaveButtonClickedHandler

      public javafx.event.EventHandler SaveButtonClickedHandler()
      Returns the event handler for clicking on the save garden button This method creates a copy of the current garden and if a unique name is given it will save the current garden as a unique entry in the list of saved gardens. If the same name or no name is given it will overwrite the loaded garden.
      Returns:
      event handler

    • getLoadGardenViewOnClickHandler

      public javafx.event.EventHandler getLoadGardenViewOnClickHandler()
      Returns the event handler for clicking the load garden button in the main screen. When activated, this method sends the user to the load gardens page
      Returns:
      event handler

    • loadSelectedGardenHandler

      public javafx.event.EventHandler loadSelectedGardenHandler()
      Returns the event handler for selecting a garden to load. When activated, this method loads the garden picked by the user on the load menu. The string highlighted in the ListView is used to find the garden in list of saved gardens. Once it has the garden it draws the plots in their plants in the garden editor
      Returns:
      event

    • deleteSelectedGardenHandler

      public javafx.event.EventHandler deleteSelectedGardenHandler()
      Returns the event handler for deleting a garden. When activated, this method deletes the garden selected by the user in the load menu. Uses the string from the listView to find the right garden, removes it from the arrayList of saved gardens, and then saves the arraylist to overwrite the old list.
      Returns:
      event

    • fromLoadToHome

      public javafx.event.EventHandler fromLoadToHome()
      Returns the event handler for clicking the home button When activated, this method takes the user from the load menu to the home screen if they click the back button.
      Returns:
      event

    • generateReportHandler

      public javafx.event.EventHandler generateReportHandler()
      Returns the event handler that handles the report generation when the generate report button is clicked in ReportView. When activated, this method will send the proper information to display the desired report
      Returns:
      event handler

    • onClickedWebpageHandler

      public javafx.event.EventHandler onClickedWebpageHandler()
      Returns the event handler for opening a webpage from Learn More Hyperlinks When activated this method will launch the hyperlink that was clicked on
      Returns:
      event handler

    • lepPopUpHandler

      public javafx.event.EventHandler lepPopUpHandler()

      Returns:
      event handler
